page.title: 24Buses of Sheffield
page.content: Buses in Sheffield were deregulated in the late 1980's and many firms were competing for routes and the High street was very congested and full of fumes. The Supertram came to Sheffield in the 1990's and brought in by the council. The installation of the tram network caused much disruption and opposition. Park and ride schemes emerged in Middlewood and Malin Bridge. Bus fares have escalated due to privatisation, but we do have a free bus (freebie) which runs from Pond Street on a daily basis. The main bus station in Sheffield has now been re-generated.
